citation.article-title: A new 3-hydroxybutyrate fermenting anaerobe, Ilyobacter polytropus, gen. nov. sp. nov., possessing various fermentation pathways

p.s: Description of Ilyobacter polytropus sp. nov.
Ilyobacter polytropus (po.ly'tro.pus. Gr. adj. polytropos, versatile, witty. M. L. adj. polytropus, referring to metabolic versatility)
Rod-shaped cells, 0.7 x 1.5-3.0 μm in size with rounded ends, single or in pairs.
Nonmotile, Gram-negative, non-sporeforming.
Strictly anaerobic chemoorganotroph.
3-Hydroxybutyrate and crotonate fermented to acetate and butyrate.
Glycerol fermented to 1,3-propanediol and 3-hydroxypropionate.
Malate and fumarate fermented to acetate, formate and propionate.
Glucose and fructose fermented to acetate, formate and ethanol.
No other organic acids, sugars, or alcohols found to be metabolized.
Sulfate, sulfur, thiosulfate or nitrate not reduced.
Growth occurs in mineral media with a reductant.
Indole not formed, gelatin or urea not hydrolyzed.
No catalase activity.
Selective enrichment in NaCl-containing mineral media with 3-hydroxybutyrate as substrate, pH range: 6.5-8.5, optimum at 7.0-7.5.
Temperature range: 10-35°C, optimum growth temperature 30°C.
No cytochromes detectable.
DNA base ratio: 32.2±0.5 mol% G + C (thermal denaturation).
Habitats: anaerobic muds of marine origin.
Type strain: CuHbul, DSM 2926; deposited in Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen, Göttingen, FRG.
